result.execSummary:
The defendant Briana Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--in Case #14CF281: to pay restitution of $1887.78 to Dave's Turf & Marine
--in Case #14CF281: to pay the 10% restitution processing fee
--in Case #14CF281: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with all recommended treatment 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no direct or indirect contact with Kendall Avery unless approved by the Agent
--no presence at Dave's Turf & Marine in Watertown WI 
--to maintain absolute sobriety from both alcohol and all non-prescribed controlled substances
--to write a letter of apology to Leni Kahler (victim in #14CF281) within thirty days; to be submitted through the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision 


The Court will allow expungement of these cases if Ms. Krueger successfully completes the Probation terms. 

The Court finds that, if Probation is revoked, Ms. Krueger will be eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program

Nunc Pro Tunc 2/2/16

of the 12/19/14 Sentencing After Revocation Hearing held before the Honorable Judge Jennifer L. Weston
DOC Screen Shot

cases #14CF191 and #14CF281 called at 10:27am. [MK]
Defendant Briana  Krueger in court, in custody, with Attorney Bradley Jansen.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing arguments given by counsel.

On Case #14CF191 on Count #2, the Court sentences Ms. Krueger  to  3  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1  year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2  years .  This sentence is to commence forthwith. 

On Case #14CF281 on Count #1,The Court sentences Ms. Krueger  to 2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1  year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1  year.  This sentence is consecutive to Case #14CF191.


The Court finds that Ms. Krueger is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Ms. Krueger is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 

In Case #14CF191: The Court gives  55  days credit for time already served.
In Case #14CF281: The Court gives  1 day credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with all recommended treatment 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no direct or indirect contact with Kendall Avery unless approved by the Agent
--no presence at Dave's Turf & Marine in Watertown WI 
--to maintain absolute sobriety from both alcohol and all non-prescribed controlled substances
--to write a letter of apology to Leni Kahler (victim in #14CF281); to be submitted through the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--in Case #14CF281: to pay restitution of $1887.78 to Dave's Turf & Marine
--in Case #14CF281: to pay the 10% restitution processing fee
--in Case #14CF191: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--in Case #14CF281: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 10:46am.
Attorney Bradley Jansen
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 19, 2014 at 10:00 am.
With elements/JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

records.addlTxt: [MK]
[MK]
[MK]

[Clerk: MK]
cases #14CF191, #14CF255, #14CF281 called at 11:34am. 
Defendant Briana  Krueger in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
-----------------------
In Case #14CF281:
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Ms. Krueger waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.
Service of Information admitted, reading waived.
-------------------------

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewd; pleas of " Guilty " entered on Count #2 of Case #14CF191 and on Count #1 of Case #14CF281; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Ms. Krueger guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #14CF255.

On both Count #2 of Case #14CF191 and on Count #1 of Case #14CF281 the Court withholds sentence, and places Ms. Krueger on Probation for three years, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with all recommended treatment 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no direct or indirect contact with Kendall Avery unless approved by the Agent
--no presence at Dave's Turf & Marine in Watertown WI 
--to maintain absolute sobriety from both alcohol and all non-prescribed controlled substances
--to write a letter of apology to Leni Kahler (victim in #14CF281) within thirty days; to be submitted through the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--in Case #14CF281: to pay restitution of $1887.78 to Dave's Turf & Marine
--in Case #14CF281: to pay the 10% restitution processing fee
--in Case #14CF191: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--in Case #14CF281: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  1 day credit on case #14CF191 and on case #14CF281 each (this credit is from time served in read-in case #14CF255).
The Court will allow expungement of these cases if Ms. Krueger successfully completes the Probation terms. The Court clarifies that Ms. Krueger will need to file a petition for this after the Probation term is completed.
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings are given. 
Contact prohibition warnings/penalties given.
The Court finds that, if Probation is revoked, Ms. Krueger will be eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.

recess 12:05pm.
